text: For the purposes of Class T— “ aerodrome operator ” means the person who is for the time being responsible for the management of the aerodrome; “ appropriate notice ” means a notice signed and dated by or on behalf of the developer and containing— the name of the developer; the address or location of the proposed development; a description of the proposed development (including its siting and appearance and the height of any mast); “ development ancillary to radio equipment housing ” means the construction, installation, alteration or replacement of structures, equipment or means of access which are ancillary to and reasonably required for the purposes of the radio equipment housing; “ mast ” means a radio mast or a radio tower; “ owner ” means any person who is the estate owner in respect of the fee simple, or who is entitled to a tenancy granted or extended for a term of years certain of which not less than 7 years remain unexpired; “ relevant day ” means— 7th June 2006; or where apparatus is installed pursuant to planning permission granted on or after 7th June 2006, the date when that apparatus is finally installed pursuant to that permission, whichever is later; “ relevant period ” means a period which expires— 6 months from the commencement of the construction, installation, alteration or replacement of any apparatus or structure permitted by Class T(a) or Class T(c) or from the commencement of the use permitted by Class T(b), as the case may be; or when the need for such apparatus, structure or use ceases, whichever occurs first; and “ tenant ” means the tenant of an agricultural holding any part of which is comprised in the land to which the proposed development relates.

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: The erection, extension or alteration on a closed defence site by or on behalf of the Crown of— a single living accommodation; b a non-residential building.

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: Development is not permitted by Class TA—

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: within 15 metres of the closed defence site’s perimeter (“the perimeter”);

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: within 25 metres of the perimeter where the development would be visible from a highway and—

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: i in the case of a building erected, the height of the building would exceed 10 metres;

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: ii in the case of a building extended or altered, the height of the building would exceed the lesser of— aa the height of the existing building, or bb 10 metres;

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: at any other location if the height of—

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: i any building erected would exceed 12 metres;

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: ii any building extended or altered would exceed the lesser of— aa the height of the existing building, or bb 12 metres;

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: on land which is or forms part of—

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: i article 2(3) land;

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: ii a site of special scientific interest;

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: iii a listed building or land within its curtilage;

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: iv a scheduled monument or land within its curtilage.

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: Development is not permitted by Class TA(a) if the total floor space of any buildings added to the closed defence site via erection or extension under Class TA(a) would exceed 25% of the total floor space of single living accommodation on the closed defence site immediately before 11th January 2022.

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: Development is not permitted by Class TA(b) if the total floor space of any buildings added to the closed defence site via erection or extension under Class TA(b) would exceed 35% of the total floor space of non-residential buildings at the closed defence site immediately before 11th January 2022.

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: Development is permitted by Class TA subject to the conditions that before beginning development the developer must—

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: assess the contamination and flood risks of the development,

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: identify measures to reduce so far as practicable any contamination or flood risks of the development,

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: where the development is in an area within Flood Zone 3, carry out prior consultation in accordance with paragraph TA.3, and

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: in any event, provide written notification to the local planning authority—

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: i of the date on which it is proposed to begin development, and

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: ii including a description of the development containing sufficient information to enable the local authority to satisfy itself that the development complies with the provisions of Class TA.

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: Development is permitted by Class TA subject to the condition that it is carried out in accordance with any measures identified under paragraph TA.2(1)(b) to reduce so far as practicable any contamination or flood risks.

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: Where the total footprint of any buildings added to the closed defence site via erection or extension under Class TA exceeds (or would, as a result of the proposed development, exceed) 4,000 square metres, development is permitted by Class TA subject to the condition that before beginning the development the developer must apply to the local planning authority for a determination as to whether the prior approval of the authority will be required as to the siting and scale of the development.

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: The conditions in sub-paragraph (5) apply where proposed development relates to the erection or extension of a building which will be—

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: visible from a highway,

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: of height in excess of 10 metres, and

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: either—

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: i single living accommodation which will be higher than the highest existing single living accommodation on the closed defence site, or

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: ii a non-residential building which will be higher than the highest existing non-residential building on the closed defence site.

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: Proposed development described in sub-paragraph (4) is permitted by Class TA subject to the conditions that—

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: the proposed development is sited and its external appearance designed so as to minimise so far as practicable its effect on the amenity of the area, and

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: before beginning the development the developer must apply to the local planning authority for a determination as to whether the prior approval of the authority will be required as to the external appearance of the building.

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: An application under sub-paragraph (3) or (5)(b) is to be made and determined in accordance with paragraph TA.4.

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: Where a developer is required to carry out prior consultation under paragraph TA.2(1)(c), the developer must consult the Environment Agency as to the flood risks of the proposed development.

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: The developer must notify the Environment Agency specifying the date by which they must respond (not being less than 21 days from the date the notice is given) (“the closing date”).

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: The development must not begin—

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: before the occurrence of one of the following—

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: i the receipt by the developer of responses to the consultation required by this paragraph, or

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: ii the day after the closing date.

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: in any event, before the developer takes into account any representations received on or before the closing date as a result of consultation under this paragraph.

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: Where the developer receives representations on or before the closing date as a result of consultation under this paragraph, the developer must as soon as reasonably practicable send to the local planning authority—

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: a copy of the representations, and

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: a statement explaining how the developer has taken the representations into account.

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: The following provisions apply where a developer is required under paragraph TA.2(3) or (5)(b) to make an application for a determination as to whether the prior approval of the authority will be required.

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: The application must be accompanied by—

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: a written description of the proposed development including a statement of any proposed increase in the total footprint of buildings on the closed defence site,

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: where the proposed development relates to the erection or extension of—

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: i single living accommodation, a statement showing the total floor space of single living accommodation— aa on the closed defence site immediately before 11th January 2022, bb already added to the closed defence site via development under Class TA(a), and cc to be added to the closed defence site via the proposed development;

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: ii a non-residential building, a statement showing the total floor space of non-residential buildings— aa on the closed defence site immediately before 11th January 2022, bb already added to the closed defence site via development under Class TA(b), and cc to be added to the closed defence site via the proposed development;

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: a plan indicating the closed defence site and showing the proposed development,

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: drawings prepared to an identified scale and showing—

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: i in the case of a building to be erected, the proposed external dimensions and elevations of that building;

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: ii in the case of a building to be extended or altered, the external dimensions and elevations of that building both before and after the proposed extension or alteration,

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: the developer’s contact address and, if they are content to receive communications electronically, the developer’s email address, and

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: any fee required to be paid.

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: The local planning authority may refuse an application where, in the opinion of the authority— any conditions, limitations or restrictions specified in Class TA applicable to the development in question.

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: the proposed development does not comply with, or

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: the developer has, following a requirement imposed under paragraph TA.4(6), provided insufficient information to enable the authority to establish whether the proposed development complies with,

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: Sub-paragraphs (5) and (7) do not apply where a local planning authority refuses an application under sub-paragraph (3) and for the purposes of section 78 (appeals) of the Act such a refusal is to be treated as a refusal of an application for approval.

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: The local planning authority must give notice of the proposed development—

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: by site display in at least one place on or near the land to which the application relates for not less than 21 days of a notice which—

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: i describes the proposed development,

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: ii provides the address of the proposed development, and

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: iii specifies the date by which representations are to be received by the local planning authority (not being less than 21 days from the date the notice is displayed), or

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: by serving a notice in that form on any owner or occupier of any premises which adjoin the closed defence site.

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: The local planning authority may require the developer to submit such information as the authority may reasonably require to determine the application.

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: The local planning authority must, when determining an application—

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: take into account any representations made to them as a result of any notice given under sub-paragraph (5), and

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: have regard to the National Planning Policy Framework issued by the Ministry of Housing, Communities and Local Government in July 2021, so far as relevant to the subject matter of the prior approval, as if the application were a planning application.

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: The development must not begin before the occurrence of one of the following—

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: the receipt by the applicant from the local planning authority of a written notice of their determination that such prior approval is not required;

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: the receipt by the applicant from the local planning authority of a written notice giving their prior approval;

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: the expiry of 56 days following the date on which the application was received by the local planning authority without the authority notifying the applicant as to whether prior approval is given or refused.

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: The development must be carried out— unless the local planning authority and the developer agree otherwise in writing.

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: where prior approval is required, in accordance with the details approved by the local planning authority;

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: where prior approval is not required, or where sub-paragraph (8)(c) applies, in accordance with the details provided in the application referred to in sub-paragraph (2),

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: The local planning authority may grant prior approval unconditionally or subject to conditions reasonably related to the subject matter of the approval.

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: When computing the number of days in sub-paragraph (5)(a), any day which is a public holiday must be disregarded.

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
class_block: Class TA – development by the Crown on a closed defence site
text: For the purposes of Class TA— “ closed defence site ” means a site which is— on Crown land, used exclusively for defence purposes, and surrounded by a closed perimeter; “ footprint ”, in relation to a building, means the total area of ground covered by it; “ non-residential building ” means a building which is used exclusively for defence purposes other than as— single living accommodation, or a dwellinghouse within the meaning of Class C3 of Schedule 1 to the Use Classes Order; “ single living accommodation ” means a building used for the purpose of providing living accommodation for single or unaccompanied persons.

part_title: Development by the Crown or for national security purposes
text: For the purposes of Part 19— “ airbase ” means the aggregate of the land, buildings and works comprised in a Government aerodrome within the meaning of paragraph 1 of Schedule 1 to the Air Navigation Order 2016 ; and “ air traffic services ” has the same meaning as in section 98 of the Transport Act 2000 (air traffic services) .

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: Development consisting of works for the demolition of one or other of— existing on 12 March 2020, together with its replacement by a single building covered by sub-paragraph (2), involving operations listed in sub-paragraph (3).

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: any building comprising a single purpose-built detached block of flats, and

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: any other single detached building, comprising premises established— or for any combination of them,

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: i for office use falling within Class B1(a) of the Schedule to the 1987 Order,

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: ii for research and development falling within Class B1(b) of the Schedule to the 1987 Order, or

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: iii for an industrial process falling within Class B1(c) of the Schedule to the 1987 Order,

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: The building in question is to comprise one or other of—

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: a purpose-built detached block of flats, or

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: a purpose-built detached dwellinghouse.

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: The operations in question are—

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: operations reasonably necessary for the demolition and construction, which may include the installation of a basement or cellar in the new building, whether or not there is one in the old building;

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: works for the removal of plant servicing the old building;

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: works for the disconnection of services from the old building;

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: works for the removal of any means of access to and egress from the old building;

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: works for the removal of storage and waste from the old building;

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: works for the installation of plant to service the new building;

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: works for the installation of services to be connected to the new building;

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: works to enable access to and egress from the new building, including means of escape from fire;

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: works for the construction, within the new building, of storage, waste or other ancillary facilities to support the new building;

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: the use of scaffolding and other temporary structures to support the operations listed in paragraphs (a) to (i) over a period—

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: i starting with their installation no earlier than one month before the beginning of those operations, and

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: ii ending with their removal no later than one month after the completion of those operations.

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: In relation to Class ZA— “development” includes any change of use from the use of the old building to the use of the new building within Class C3 of the Schedule to the 1987 Order; “the 1987 Order” means the Use Classes Order as in force on 12 March 2020; “the old building” and “the new building” respectively mean the building proposed for demolition and the building proposed as replacement; and “services” means water, drainage, electricity, gas, and other services to the extent reasonably necessary for the new building to function as the building in question as defined by sub-paragraph (2) above.

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: Development is not permitted by Class ZA— a if land covered by, or within the curtilage of, the old building— i is occupied in any part under an agricultural tenancy, unless the express consent of both the landlord and the tenant has been obtained; ii is or forms part of article 2(3) land; iii is or forms part of a site of special scientific interest; iv is or forms part of a listed building or land within its curtilage; v is or forms part of a scheduled monument or land within its curtilage; vi is or forms part of a safety hazard area; vii is or forms part of a military explosives storage area; or viii is within 3 kilometres of the perimeter of an aerodrome; b if the old building was constructed after 31 December 1989; c if the footprint of the old building exceeds 1,000 square metres; d if the height of the highest part of the roof of the old building above ground level (not including plant, radio masts and antennae) is greater than 18 metres at any point; e unless the old building has been vacant for a period of at least 6 months immediately prior to the date of the application for prior approval; f if the old building has been rendered unsafe or otherwise uninhabitable by the action or inaction of any person having an interest in the land on which the old building stands and it is practicable to secure safety or health by works of repair or works for affording temporary support (and for this purpose keeping the old building vacant does not of itself count as action or inaction); g if the demolition is “relevant demolition” for the purposes of section 196D of the Act (demolition of an unlisted etc building in a conservation area); h if any of the footprint of the new building falls outside the footprint of the old building; i if any part of the exterior wall of the new building nearest to a highway is nearer to the highway than the part nearest the highway of the exterior wall nearest the highway of the old building; j if the height (not including plant, radio masts and antennae) of the new building would at any point exceed the lower of— i 7 metres above the height (not including plant) of old building; or ii 18 metres, above ground level; k if the new building has more than X + 2 storeys, where “X” is the number of storeys in the old building; l if the new building has more storeys than the old building and the floor to ceiling height of any additional storey in the new building, measured internally, would at any point be greater than the lower of— i the floor to ceiling height, measured internally, of any storey in the old building; or ii 3 metres; or m if the height of any plant on the roof of the new building as measured from the lowest surface of that roof would be greater than the height of any existing plant as measured from the lowest surface of the existing roof on the principal part of the old building.

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: Development under Class ZA is permitted subject to the following conditions.

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: Where any development under Class ZA is proposed, development is permitted subject to the condition that before beginning the development, the developer must apply to the local planning authority for prior approval of the authority as to—

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: transport and highways impacts of the development;

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: contamination risks in relation to the new building;

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: flooding risks in relation to the new building;

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: the design of the new building;

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: the external appearance of the new building;

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: the provision of adequate natural light in all habitable rooms of each new dwellinghouse in or comprising the new building;

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: the impact of the development on the amenity of the new building and of neighbouring premises, including overlooking, privacy and light;

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: impacts of noise from any commercial premises on the intended occupiers of the new dwellinghouses;

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: the impact on business and new residents of the development’s introduction of, or increase in, residential use in the area in which the development is to take place;

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: the impact of the development on heritage and archaeology;

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: the method of demolition of the old building;

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: the plans for landscaping of the development, including the planting and maintenance of shrubs and trees; and

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: any— unless no part of the new building (including plant, radio masts and antennae) occupies airspace not occupied by the old building (including plant, radio masts and antennae).

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: i air traffic and defence asset impacts of the development, and

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: ii impact that, because of the siting of the new building, the development will have on a protected vista identified in the Directions Relating to Protected Vistas dated 15 March 2012 by the Secretary of State,

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: In sub-paragraph (1)(h), “commercial premises” means any premises in the surrounding area which are normally used for the purpose of any commercial or industrial undertaking which existed on the date of the application under sub-paragraph (2), and includes premises licensed under the Licensing Act 2003 or any other place of public entertainment.

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: When the developer applies under sub-paragraph (2), paragraph B (procedure for applications for prior approval under Part 20) applies to the application and the material covered by paragraph B(1A) to B(1C).

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: Any development under Class ZA is permitted subject to the condition that it must be completed within a period of 3 years starting with the date prior approval is granted.

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: Any development under Class ZA is permitted subject to the condition that before beginning the development, the developer must provide the local planning authority with a report for the management of the construction of the development, which is acceptable to the authority and sets out the method of demolition, the proposed development hours of operation and how any adverse impact of noise, dust and vibration and traffic on occupiers of the new building and adjoining owners or occupiers will be mitigated, the proposed use of materials, and the plans for the disposal and recycling of waste generated by the development and that in carrying out the development the developer must comply with the report.

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: The developer must notify the local planning authority of the completion of the development as soon as reasonably practicable after completion.

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: The notification referred to in sub-paragraph (6) must be in writing and must include—

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: the name of the developer;

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: the address or location of the development; and

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: the date of completion.

class_block: Class ZA - Demolition of buildings and construction of new dwellinghouses in their place
text: Any new dwellinghouse created under Class ZA is to remain in use as a dwellinghouse within the meaning of Class C3 of the Schedule to the 1987 Order and for no other purpose, except to the extent that the other purpose is ancillary to the primary use as a dwellinghouse.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: Development consisting of works for the construction of up to two additional storeys of new dwellinghouses immediately above the existing topmost residential storey on a building which is a purpose-built, detached block of flats, together with any or all— a engineering operations reasonably necessary to construct the additional storeys and new dwellinghouses; b works for the replacement of existing plant or installation of additional plant on the roof of the extended building reasonably necessary to service the new dwellinghouses; c works for the construction of appropriate and safe access to and egress from the new and existing dwellinghouses, including means of escape from fire, via additional external doors or external staircases; d works for the construction of storage, waste or other ancillary facilities reasonably necessary to support the new dwellinghouses.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: Development is not permitted by Class A if— a the permission to use any building as a dwellinghouse has been granted only by virtue of Class M, MA, N, O, P, PA or Q of Part 3 of this Schedule; b above ground level, the building is less than 3 storeys in height; c the building was constructed before 1st July 1948, or after 5th March 2018; d the additional storeys are constructed other than on the principal part of the building; e the floor to ceiling height of any additional storey, measured internally, would exceed the lower of— i 3 metres; or ii the floor to ceiling height, measured internally, of any storey of the principal part of the existing building; f the new dwellinghouses are not flats; g the height of the highest part of the roof of the extended building would exceed the height of the highest part of the roof of the existing building by more than 7 metres (not including plant, in each case); h the height of the highest part of the roof of the extended building (not including plant) would be greater than 30 metres; i development under Class A.(a) would include the provision of visible support structures on or attached to the exterior of the building upon completion of the development; j development under Class A.(a) would consist of engineering operations other than works within the existing curtilage of the building to— i strengthen existing walls; ii strengthen existing foundations; or iii install or replace water, drainage, electricity, gas or other services; k in the case of Class A.(b) development there is no existing plant on the building; l in the case of Class A.(b) development the height of any replaced or additional plant as measured from the lowest surface of the new roof on the principal part of the extended building would exceed the height of any existing plant as measured from the lowest surface of the existing roof on the principal part of the existing building; m development under Class A.(c) would extend beyond the curtilage of the existing building; n development under Class A.(d) would— i extend beyond the curtilage of the existing building; ii be situated on land forward of a wall forming the principal elevation of the existing building; or iii be situated on land forward of a wall fronting a highway and forming a side elevation of the existing building; o the land or site on which the building is located, is or forms part of— i article 2(3) land; ii a site of special scientific interest; iii a listed building or land within its curtilage; iv a scheduled monument or land within its curtilage; v a safety hazard area; vi a military explosives storage area; or vii land within 3 kilometres of the perimeter of an aerodrome.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: Where any development under Class A is proposed, development is permitted subject to the condition that before beginning the development, the developer must apply to the local planning authority for prior approval of the authority as to— and the provisions of paragraph B (prior approval) of this Part apply in relation to that application.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: transport and highways impacts of the development;

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: air traffic and defence asset impacts of the development;

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: contamination risks in relation to the building;

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: flooding risks in relation to the building;

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: the external appearance of the building;

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: the provision of adequate natural light in all habitable rooms of the new dwellinghouses;

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: impact on the amenity of the existing building and neighbouring premises including overlooking, privacy and the loss of light; ...

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: whether because of the siting of the building, the development will impact on a protected view identified in the Directions Relating to Protected Vistas dated 15 March 2012 issued by the Secretary of State, ...

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: where the existing building is 18 metres or more in height, the fire safety of the external wall construction of the existing building, ; and

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: where the development meets the fire risk condition, the fire safety impacts on the intended occupants of the building

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: Any development under Class A is permitted subject to the condition that it must be completed within a period of 3 years starting with the date prior approval is granted.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: Any development under Class A is permitted subject to the condition that before beginning the development, the developer must provide the local planning authority with a report for the management of the construction of the development, which sets out the proposed development hours of operation and how any adverse impact of noise, dust, vibration and traffic on occupiers of the building and adjoining owners or occupiers will be mitigated.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: The developer must notify the local planning authority of the completion of the development as soon as reasonably practicable after completion.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: The notification referred to in sub-paragraph (4) must be in writing and must include—

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: the name of the developer;

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: the address or location of the development; and

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: the date of completion.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: Any new dwellinghouse created under Class A is to remain in use as a dwellinghouse within the meaning of Class C3 of the Schedule to the Use Classes Order and for no other purpose, except to the extent that the other purpose is ancillary to the primary use as a dwellinghouse.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: The following provisions apply where under this Part, a developer is required to make an application to a local planning authority for prior approval.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: The application, if made in relation to development proposed under Class ZA, must be accompanied by— together with any fee required to be paid.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: a written description of the proposed development, which must include details of the building proposed for demolition, the building proposed as replacement and the operations proposed under paragraph ZA(3);

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: a plan, drawn to an identified scale and showing the direction of North, indicating the site of the proposed development;

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: drawings prepared to an identified scale and showing external dimensions and elevations of— and, in the direction of North, the positioning of each, together with the applicable information called for by sub-paragraph (1B);

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: i the building proposed for demolition,

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: ii the building scheduled as replacement,

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: a written statement specifying—

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: i the number of dwellinghouses in the building proposed for demolition, and

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: ii the number of new dwellinghouses proposed in the building proposed as replacement,

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: where sub-paragraph (6) requires the Environment Agency to be consulted, a site-specific flood risk assessment;

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: a written statement in respect of heritage and archaeological considerations of the development;

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: the developer’s contact address; and

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: the developer’s email address if the developer is content to receive communications electronically;

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: The information referred to in sub-paragraph (1A)(c), which so far as practicable, is to be presented in the direction of North and to show elevations is—

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: where the building proposed as replacement is a block of flats—

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: i the position and dimensions of windows, doors and walls in the block and in each dwellinghouse in it, and

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: ii the dimensions and use of all habitable and other rooms in each dwellinghouse in it;

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: where the building proposed as replacement is a single dwellinghouse—

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: i the position and dimensions of the windows, doors and walls in it, and

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: ii the dimensions and use of all habitable and other rooms in it.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: Sub-paragraph (2) does not apply to any application made in relation to development proposed under Class ZA.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: The application must be accompanied by— together with any fee required to be paid.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: a written description of the proposed development, which, in relation to development proposed under any of Classes A to AD , must include details of any dwellinghouse and other works proposed under paragraph A(a) to (d), AA(1)(a) to (d), AB(3)(a) to (d), AC(2)(a) to (c), or AD(2)(a) to (c) (as the case may be) ;

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: a plan which is drawn to an identified scale and shows the direction of North indicating the site and showing the proposed development;

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: floor plans which are drawn to an identified scale and show the direction of North indicating the total floor space in square metres of each dwellinghouse, the dimensions and proposed use of each room, the position and dimensions of windows, doors and walls, and the existing and proposed elevations of the building;

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: a written statement specifying the number of new dwellinghouses proposed by the development (that is, additional to any dwellinghouses in the existing building) ;

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: a list of all addresses of any flats and any other premises in the existing building ;

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: the developer’s contact address;

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: the developer’s email address if the developer is content to receive communications electronically; ...

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: where—

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: i sub-paragraph (6) requires the Environment Agency to be consulted, a site-specific flood risk assessment;

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: ii sub-paragraph (6A) requires the Health and Safety Executive to be consulted, a statement about the fire safety design principles, concepts and standards that have been applied to the development; , and

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: where the application for prior approval relates to the requirement mentioned in paragraph A.2(1)(i) or AA.2(1)(k), a report from a chartered engineer or other competent professional confirming that the external wall construction of the existing building complies with paragraph B4(1) of Schedule 1 to the Building Regulations 2010,

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: The local planning authority may refuse an application where, in the opinion of the authority— any conditions, limitations or restrictions specified in this Part as being applicable to the development in question.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: the proposed development does not comply with, or

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: the developer has provided insufficient information to enable the authority to establish whether the proposed development complies with,

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: Sub-paragraphs (5) to (10) and (12) do not apply where a local planning authority refuses an application under sub-paragraph (3) and for the purposes of section 78 (appeals) of the Act such a refusal is to be treated as a refusal of an application for approval.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: Where the application relates to prior approval as to transport and highways impacts of the development, on receipt of the application where in the opinion of the local planning authority the development is likely to result in a material increase or a material change in the character of traffic in the vicinity of the site, the local planning authority must consult—

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: where the increase or change relates to traffic entering or leaving a trunk road, the highway authority for the trunk road;

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: the local highway authority, where the increase or change relates to traffic entering or leaving a classified road or proposed highway, except where the local planning authority is the local highway authority; and

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: the operator of the network which includes or consists of the railway in question, and the Secretary of State for Transport, where the increase or change relates to traffic using a level crossing over a railway.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: Where the application relates to prior approval as to the flooding risks on the site, on receipt of the application, the local planning authority must consult the Environment Agency where the development is—

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: in an area within Flood Zone 2 or Flood Zone 3; or

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: in an area within Flood Zone 1 which has critical drainage problems and which has been notified to the local planning authority by the Environment Agency for the purpose of paragraph (zc)(ii) in the Table in Schedule 4 to the Procedure Order.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: Where the application relates to prior approval as to fire safety impacts, on receipt of the application, the local planning authority must consult the Health and Safety Executive.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: Where the application relates to prior approval as to the impact on air traffic or defence assets, the local planning authority must consult any relevant operators of aerodromes, technical sites or defence assets and where appropriate the Civil Aviation Authority and the Secretary of State for Defence.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: Where an aerodrome, technical site or defence asset is identified on a safeguarding map provided to the local planning authority, the local planning authority must not grant prior approval contrary to the advice of the operator of the aerodrome, technical site or defence asset, the Civil Aviation Authority or the Secretary of State for Defence.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: Where the application relates to prior approval as to natural light, the local planning authority must refuse prior approval if adequate natural light is not provided in all the habitable rooms of the dwellinghouses.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: Where the application relates to prior approval under paragraph A.2(1)(i) or AA.2(1)(k), the local planning authority must refuse prior approval if the application is not accompanied by the report mentioned in subparagraph (2)(i) above.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: Where the application relates to prior approval as to the impact on protected views, the local planning authority must consult Historic England, the Mayor of London and any local planning authorities identified in the Directions Relating to Protected Vistas dated 15th March 2012 issued by the Secretary of State.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: Where the application relates to a prior approval as to the impact of the development on heritage and archaeology, the local planning authority must so far as they consider reasonably practicable consult any bodies that they consider to have heritage and archaeological expertise relevant to their functions under Part 3 of the Act and this Order.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: The local planning authority must notify the consultees referred to in sub-paragraphs (5), (6), (6A) (7), (10) and (10A) specifying the date by which they must respond, being not less than 21 days from the date the notice is given.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: The local planning authority must give notice of the proposed development—

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: by site display in at least one place on or near the land to which the application relates for not less than 21 days of a notice which—

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: i describes the proposed development;

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: ii provides the address of the proposed development; and

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: iii specifies the date by which representations are to be received by the local planning authority;

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: unless the proposed development falls within Class ZA, by serving a notice in that form on all owners and occupiers of any flats and any other premises within the existing building ; and

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: by serving a notice in that form on any adjoining owner or occupier.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: When computing the number of days in sub-paragraphs (11) and (12)(a), any day which is a public holiday must be disregarded.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: The local planning authority may require the developer to submit such information as the authority may reasonably require in order to determine the application, which may include—

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: assessments of impacts or risks;

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: statements setting out how impacts or risks are to be mitigated, having regard to the National Planning Policy Framework issued by the Ministry of Housing, Communities and Local Government in July 2021 ; or

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: details of proposed building or other operations.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: The local planning authority must, when determining an application—

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: take into account any representations made to them as a result of any consultation under sub-paragraph (5), (6), (7) or (10) and any notice given under sub-paragraph (12);

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: have regard to the National Planning Policy Framework issued by the Ministry of Housing, Communities and Local Government in July 2021 , so far as relevant to the subject matter of the prior approval, as if the application were a planning application; and

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: in relation to the contamination risks on the site—

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: i determine whether, as a result of the proposed development, taking into account any proposed mitigation, the site will be contaminated land as described in Part 2A of the Environmental Protection Act 1990, and in doing so have regard to the Contaminated Land Statutory Guidance issued by the Secretary of State for the Environment, Food and Rural Affairs in April 2012, and

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: ii if they determine that the site will be contaminated land, refuse to give prior approval.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: The development must not begin before the receipt by the applicant from the local planning authority of a written notice giving their prior approval.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: The development must be carried out in accordance with the details approved by the local planning authority.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: The local planning authority may grant prior approval unconditionally or subject to conditions reasonably related to the subject matter of the prior approval.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: For the purposes of Part 20— “agricultural tenancy” means a tenancy under— the Agricultural Holdings Act 1986; or the Agricultural Tenancies Act 1995; “block of flats” means a building which is divided horizontally and consists of separate and self-contained premises constructed for use for the purposes of a dwellinghouse, and any ancillary facilities constructed solely for use by occupiers of the building; “defence asset” is a site identified on a safeguarding map provided to the local planning authority for the purposes of a direction made by the Secretary of State in exercise of the powers conferred by article 31(1) of the Procedure Order or any previous powers to the like effect; “detached” means that the building does not share a party wall with a neighbouring building; “flat” means a separate and self-contained premises constructed for use for the purposes of a dwellinghouse; “footprint”, in relation to a building, means the total area of ground covered by it; “habitable rooms” means any rooms used or intended to be used for sleeping or living which are not solely used for cooking purposes, but does not include bath or toilet facilities, service rooms, corridors, laundry rooms, hallways or utility rooms; “principal part” means the main part of the building excluding any front, side or rear extension of a lower height, whether this forms part of the original building or a subsequent addition; “purpose-built”, in relation to a building (whether a block of flats or a dwellinghouse), means built as such and remaining as such; ... “row”, in relation to a terrace building, means the row of two or more terrace buildings of which it forms part, where each building in the row— shares a party wall with, or has a main wall adjoining the main wall of, the building on either side; or if it is the end of a row— in the case of a row comprising more than two buildings, it shares a party wall with, or has a main wall adjoining the main wall of, a building which fulfils the requirements of paragraph (a); or in the case of a row comprising only two buildings, it shares a party wall with, or has a main wall adjoining the main wall of, the other building in the row; “technical sites” has the same meaning as in ... the Town and Country Planning (Safeguarded Aerodromes, Technical Sites and Military Explosives Storage Areas) Direction 2002. “terrace building” means a building which is not detached. and accordingly, references to an “additional storey” include a storey constructed in reliance on the permission granted by this Part which replaces accommodation within the roof of the existing building.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: any storey below ground level; or

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: any accommodation within the roof of a building, whether comprising part of the original building or created by a subsequent addition or alteration,

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: In Part 20 references to a “storey” do not include— and accordingly, references to an “additional storey” include a storey constructed in reliance on the permission granted by this Part which replaces accommodation within the roof of the existing building.

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: any storey below ground level; or

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: any accommodation within the roof of a building, whether comprising part of the original building or created by a subsequent addition or alteration,

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: In Part 20, development meets the fire risk condition if the development relates to a building which will—

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: contain two or more dwellinghouses; and

class_block: Class A - New dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats
text: satisfy the height condition in paragraph (3), read with paragraph (7), of article 9A (fire statements) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015.

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: Development consisting of works for the construction of up to two additional storeys of new dwellinghouses immediately above the topmost storey on a detached building to which sub-paragraph (2) applies, together with any or all—

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: engineering operations reasonably necessary to construct the additional storeys and new dwellinghouses;

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: works for the replacement of existing plant or installation of additional plant on the roof of the extended building reasonably necessary to service the new dwellinghouses;

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: works for the construction of appropriate and safe access to and egress from the new dwellinghouses and existing premises in the building, including means of escape from fire, via additional external doors or external staircases;

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: works for the construction of storage, waste or other ancillary facilities reasonably necessary to support the new dwellinghouses.

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: This sub-paragraph applies to a building which is—

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: used for any purpose within Class A1 (shops), Class A2 (financial and professional services), Class A3 (restaurants and cafes) or Class B1(a) (offices) of the Schedule to the 1987 Order , or as a betting office, pay day loan shop or launderette;

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: in a mixed use combining—

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: i two or more uses within paragraph (a); or

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: ii a use falling within Class C3 (dwellinghouses) of the Schedule to the 1987 Order , together with one or more uses within paragraph (a).

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: In relation to Class AA, “the 1987 Order” means the Use Classes Order as in force on 5th March 2018.

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: Development is not permitted by Class AA if— za the permission to use the building as a dwellinghouse has been granted only by virtue of Class MA of Part 3 of this Schedule; a above ground level, the building is less than three storeys in height; b the building was constructed before 1st July 1948 or after 5th March 2018; c on 5th March 2018 the building was in a use other than— i a use or mixed use within paragraph AA(2)(a) or (b); or ii a use falling within Class C3 of the Schedule to the Use Classes Order; d the additional storeys are constructed other than on the principal part of the building; e the floor to ceiling height of any additional storey, measured internally, would exceed the lower of— i 3 metres; or ii the floor to ceiling height, measured internally, of any storey of the principal part of the existing building; f the new dwellinghouses are not flats; g the height of the highest part of the roof of the extended building would exceed the height of the highest part of the roof of the existing building by more than 7 metres (not including plant, in each case); h the height of the highest part of the roof of the extended building (not including plant) would be greater than 30 metres; i development under Class AA(1)(a) would include the provision of visible support structures on or attached to the exterior of the building upon completion of the development; j development under Class AA(1)(a) would consist of engineering operations other than works within the existing curtilage of the building to— i strengthen existing walls; ii strengthen existing foundations; or iii install or replace water, drainage, electricity, gas or other services; k in the case of Class AA(1)(b) development there is no existing plant on the building; l in the case of Class AA(1)(b) development the height of any replaced or additional plant as measured from the lowest surface of the new roof on the principal part of the extended building would exceed the height of any existing plant as measured from the lowest surface of the existing roof on the principal part of the existing building; m development under Class AA(1)(c) would extend beyond the curtilage of the existing building; n development under Class AA(1)(d) would— i extend beyond the curtilage of the existing building; ii be situated on land forward of a wall forming the principal elevation of the existing building; or iii be situated on land forward of a wall fronting a highway and forming a side elevation of the existing building; or o the land or site on which the building is located, is or forms part of— i article 2(3) land; ii a site of special scientific interest; iii a listed building or land within its curtilage; iv a scheduled monument or land within its curtilage; v a safety hazard area; vi a military explosives storage area; or vii land within 3 kilometres of the perimeter of an aerodrome.

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: Where any development under Class AA is proposed, development is permitted subject to the condition that before beginning the development, the developer must apply to the local planning authority for prior approval of the authority as to— and the provisions of paragraph B (prior approval) of this Part apply in relation to that application.

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: transport and highways impacts of the development;

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: air traffic and defence asset impacts of the development;

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: contamination risks in relation to the building;

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: flooding risks in relation to the building;

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: the external appearance of the building, including—

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: i the design and architectural features of— aa the principal elevation; and bb any side elevation that fronts a highway; and

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: ii the impact of any works under sub-paragraph (1)(c) or (d) of Class AA;

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: the provision of adequate natural light in all habitable rooms of the new dwellinghouses;

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: impact on the amenity of the existing building and neighbouring premises including overlooking, privacy and the loss of light;

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: impacts of noise from any commercial premises on the intended occupiers of the new dwellinghouses;

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: impacts of the introduction of, or an increase in, a residential use of premises in the area on the carrying on of any trade, business or other use of land in the area;

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: whether, because of the siting of the building, the development will impact on a protected view identified in the Directions Relating to Protected Vistas dated 15th March 2012 issued by the Secretary of State, ...

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: where the existing building is 18 metres or more in height, the fire safety of the external wall construction of the existing building, ; and

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: where the development meets the fire risk condition (see paragraph C(3) of this Part), the fire safety impacts on the intended occupants of the building

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: In sub-paragraph (1)(h), “commercial premises” means any premises in the building or the surrounding area which are normally used for the purpose of carrying on any trade or business, and includes any premises licensed under the Licensing Act 2003 or any other place of public entertainment.

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: Any development under Class AA is permitted subject to the condition that it must be completed within a period of 3 years starting with the date prior approval is granted.

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: Any development under Class AA is permitted subject to the condition that before beginning the development, the developer must provide the local planning authority with a report for the management of the construction of the development, which sets out the proposed development hours of operation and how any adverse impact of noise, dust, vibration and traffic on occupiers of the building and adjoining owners or occupiers will be mitigated.

class_block: Class AA - new dwellinghouses on detached buildings in commercial or mixed use
text: The developer must notify the local planning authority of the completion of the development as soon as reasonably practicable after completion.
